As I want to sell it for family needs, I have requested that you should I have sold the property to you for Rs. 5,93,000/- (Five lakh ninety three thousand rupees in words). The total purchase price of Rs. 5,93,000/- has been paid in advance in several installments, so the total purchase price has been fully paid. Since the total purchase price has been fully paid, I hereby transfer all my rights in the property as per the schedule and transfer the property to you on this day. From today onwards, you will pay the government taxes, etc. related to the schedule in your name, and you will be able to freely enjoy the property as per your wish, with all the rights of donation, donation, exchange, sale, etc., with the right of son, grandson, and descendants. Neither you nor your heirs nor I nor my heirs can ever have any problems, obstacles or claims. The purchased property is sold to you as if it were free from any encumbrances, encumbrances, bank loans, court foreclosures, bindings, contracts of sale, etc., and is sold to you in confidence, free from any written or undisputed conditions. I will settle all problems, obstacles and claims that may have arisen in the past regarding the purchased property at my own expense and keep it for you. This is my consent.心
M. Verbalerueres

1. This property is not assigned.
2. This property does not belong to the government, but to their affiliated organizations The above mentioned companies are not mortgaged assets.
3. We hereby declare that the property transferred by this deed does not include any buildings, mango, coconut trees or plantations, valuable minerals, granite etc., machinery, fish ponds, etc. We hereby agree to take action against us under sections 27 and 64 of the Indian Stamp Act and to pay the stamp duty if any fact is found to have been concealed in this deed.
We hereby certify that the survey number, door number, measurements and details mentioned in this deed are correct. In case of any discrepancy, the Government shall issue a copy of the same under section 16 of the Indian Stamp (Andhra Pradesh Amendment) Act, 2002. We hereby certify that in case of any default in payment of stamp duty as amended by section 70(2), we are liable to pay a penalty of three times the original stamp duty as per section 41(a). We hereby certify that we have duly recorded in the deed the full facts of the case, the consideration and the market value of the property for the purpose of levying stamp duty under section 27 of the Indian Stamp Act, 1899, and that if we do not act as per section 27, we are entitled to recover the said amount from us by levying penalty and regular stamp duty as per section 64 and 64A. We hereby declare that we consent to the prosecution against us. We hereby declare that we have entered in the deed all the particulars necessary for the identification of the property, including the boundaries, door number, full address, etc., in accordance with Section 21 of the Indian Registration Act, 1908. We have read and heard all the matters in the presence of the following witnesses. We hereby acknowledge that all these are as stated and written by us and that the scribe has written all that we have said. X. M. This declaration is to inform that in the course of preparing this document, I/We have thoroughly examined all the necessary elements such as property taluk passbooks, adangal copies, link documents, tax receipts for the land/houses, details of the parties in the link documents, addresses of the parties, photos of the parties, details of the property, etc. and have included them in this document and have prepared the document This deed has been executed after physical inspection of the Scheduled Property, taking measurements and taking E.C. of the said property under Section 22(B) and after ascertaining that the said property has not been mortgaged, sold or encumbered to any person.
Annexure - III Declaration
“I/We hereby declare that the property mentioned in the deed is not previously alienated and that if any of the provisions of Section 22(B) of the Registration Act, 1908 are found to be in violation, I/We shall be liable to be punished under Section 82 of the Registration Act, 1908”.
In future, the officials of Registration and Stamp Duty shall be liable to pay the stamp duty and other charges on the said property. We are solely responsible for all matters.
Neither the Sub-Registrar nor the document writer has any connection with this document. This is a declaration that I/We have read this document completely and have signed it with my/our full consent.

encumbranceDetails.description: VILL/COL: BELLAMKONDA/ALL(0-0) W-B: 0-0 SURVEY: 634 HOUSE: 2-103 EXTENT: 97.22SQ.Yds BUILT: 313SQ. FT Boundires: [N]: GANDLA JYOTHI HOUSE, 12.5 FEETS [S] CEMENT ROAD, 12.5 FEETS [E]: CHIMATA VENKATARATNAM HOUSE, 70 FEETS [W]: MANDALANENI VENKAYAMMA HOUSE, 70 FEETS

sections.content: The property covered under Sale deed No. 898 of 2026 dated 27-Jan-2026, executed by Mandalaneni Venkateswara Rao in favour of Mandalaneni Satyanarayana, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 97.22 Sq,Yds, bearing house number 2-103, Old Assessment No. 303, Assessment No. 200027000300, comprised in survey number 634, situated in Bellamkonda Village and Nandirajupalem Gram Panchayat, Bellamkonda Mandal, within the District of Palnadu, registered at sub-registrar office Piduguralla, is bounded as follows: North by: 12.5 Ft. House of Gandla Jyothi South by: 12.5 Ft. Cement Road East by: 70 Ft. House of Chimata Venkataratnam West by: 70 Ft. House of Mandalaneni Venkayamma

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note : 1. It is to be noted that the property has been transferred through a Sale Deed between family members, rather than a Gift Deed. Kindly verify the rationale for opting for a sale transaction instead of a gift deed. 2. It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
